verses.verse: בֵּלְשַׁאצַּ֣ר <WH1113> be-le-shatz-Tzar Belshazzar מַלְכָּ֗א <WH4430> mal-Ka, the king עֲבַד֙ <WH5648> 'a-Vad made לְחֶ֣ם <WH3900> le-Chem feast רַ֔ב <WH7229> Rav, a great לְרַבְרְבָנ֖וֹהִי <WH7261> le-rav-re-va-No-hi of his lords אֲלַ֑ף <WH506> 'a-Laf; to a thousand וְלָקֳבֵ֥ל <WH6903> ve-lo-ko-Vel before אַלְפָּ֖א <WH506> 'al-Pa the thousand חַמְרָ֥א <WH2562> cham-Ra wine שָׁתֵֽה׃ <WH8355> sha-Teh. and drank

בֵּלְשַׁאצַּ֞ר <WH1113> be-le-shatz-Tzar Belshazzar אֲמַ֣ר׀ <WH560> 'a-Mar commanded בִּטְעֵ֣ם <WH2939> bit-'Em make to eat חַמְרָ֗א <WH2562> cham-Ra, the wine לְהַיְתָיָה֙ <WH858> le-hay-ta-Yah to bring לְמָאנֵי֙ <WH3984> le-ma-Nei vessels דַּהֲבָ֣א <WH1722> da-ha-Va the golden וְכַסְפָּ֔א <WH3702> ve-chas-Pa, and silver דִּ֤י <WH1768> di which הַנְפֵּק֙ <WH5312> han-Pek had taken נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּ֣ר <WH5020> ne-vu-chad-netz-Tzar Nebuchadnezzar אֲב֔וּהִי <WH2> 'a-Vu-hi, which his father מִן־ <WH4481> min- out of הֵיכְלָ֖א <WH1965> heich-La the temple דִּ֣י <WH1768> di which בִירוּשְׁלֶ֑ם <WH3390> vi-ru-she-Lem; which [was] in Jerusalem וְיִשְׁתּ֣וֹן <WH8355> ve-yish-Ton might drink בְּה֗וֹן <WH99999> be-Hon, מַלְכָּא֙ <WH4430> mal-Ka that the king וְרַבְרְבָנ֔וֹהִי <WH7261> ve-rav-re-va-No-hi, and his princes שֵׁגְלָתֵ֖הּ <WH7695> she-ge-la-Teh his wives וּלְחֵנָתֵֽהּ׃ <WH3904> u-le-che-na-Teh. and his concubines

בֵּאדַ֗יִן <WH116> be-Da-yin, Then הַיְתִיו֙ <WH858> hay-Tiv they brought מָאנֵ֣י <WH3984> ma-Nei vessels דַהֲבָ֔א <WH1722> da-ha-Va, the golden דִּ֣י <WH1768> di which הַנְפִּ֗קוּ <WH5312> han-Pi-ku, that were taken מִן־ <WH4481> min- out of הֵֽיכְלָ֛א <WH1965> heich-La the temple דִּֽי־ <WH1768> di- which בֵ֥ית <WH1005> veit of the house אֱלָהָ֖א <WH426> 'e-la-Ha of God דִּ֣י <WH1768> di which בִירֽוּשְׁלֶ֑ם <WH3390> vi-ru-she-Lem; which [was] at Jerusalem וְאִשְׁתִּ֣יו <WH8355> ve-'ish-Tiv drank בְּה֗וֹן <WH99999> be-Hon, מַלְכָּא֙ <WH4430> mal-Ka and the king וְרַבְרְבָנ֔וֹהִי <WH7261> ve-rav-re-va-No-hi, and his princes שֵׁגְלָתֵ֖הּ <WH7695> she-ge-la-Teh his wives וּלְחֵנָתֵֽהּ׃ <WH3904> u-le-che-na-Teh. and his concubines

אִשְׁתִּ֖יו <WH8355> 'ish-Tiv They drank חַמְרָ֑א <WH2562> cham-Ra; wine וְ֠שַׁבַּחוּ <WH7624> Ve-shab-ba-chu and praised לֵֽאלָהֵ֞י <WH426> le-la-Hei the gods דַּהֲבָ֧א <WH1722> da-ha-Va of gold וְכַסְפָּ֛א <WH3702> ve-chas-Pa and of silver נְחָשָׁ֥א <WH5174> ne-cha-Sha of brass פַרְזְלָ֖א <WH6523> far-ze-La of iron אָעָ֥א <WH636> 'a-'A of wood וְאַבְנָֽא׃ <WH69> ve-'av-Na. and of stone

בַּהּ־ bah- שַׁעֲתָ֗ה <WH8160> sha-'a-Tah, In the same hour; נְפַקוּ ne-fa-ku כנְפַ֙קָה֙ <WH5312> ne-Fa-kah go קאֶצְבְּעָן֙ <WH677> 'etz-be-'An fingers דִּ֣י <WH1768> di forasmuch יַד־ <WH3028> yad- hand אֱנָ֔שׁ <WH606> 'e-Nash, of a man's וְכָֽתְבָן֙ <WH3790> ve-cha-te-Van and wrote לָקֳבֵ֣ל <WH6903> lo-ko-Vel over against נֶבְרַשְׁתָּ֔א <WH5043> nev-rash-Ta, the candlestick עַל־ <WH5922> 'al- upon גִּירָ֕א <WH1528> gi-Ra the plaister דִּֽי־ <WH1768> di- forasmuch כְתַ֥ל <WH3797> che-Tal of the wall הֵיכְלָ֖א <WH1965> heich-La palace דִּ֣י <WH1768> di forasmuch מַלְכָּ֑א <WH4430> mal-Ka; of the king's וּמַלְכָּ֣א <WH4430> u-mal-Ka and the king חָזֵ֔ה <WH2370> cha-Zeh, saw פַּ֥ס <WH6447> pas the part יְדָ֖ה <WH3028> ye-Dah of the hand דִּ֥י <WH1768> di did כָתְבָֽה׃ <WH3790> cha-te-Vah. that wrote

אֱדַ֤יִן <WH116> 'e-Da-yin Then מַלְכָּא֙ <WH4430> mal-Ka the king's זִיוֹ֣הִי <WH2122> zi-Yo-hi countenance שְׁנ֔וֹהִי <WH8133> she-No-hi, was changed וְרַעיֹנֹ֖הִי <WH7476> ve-ra-'-yo-No-hi and his thoughts יְבַהֲלוּנֵּ֑הּ <WH927> ye-va-ha-lun-Neh; troubled וְקִטְרֵ֤י <WH7001> ve-kit-Rei him so that the joints חַרְצֵהּ֙ <WH2783> char-Tzeh of his loins מִשְׁתָּרַ֔יִן <WH8271> mish-ta-Ra-yin, were loosed וְאַ֨רְכֻבָּתֵ֔הּ <WH755> ve-'Ar-chub-ba-Teh, and his knees דָּ֥א <WH1668> da one לְדָ֖א <WH1668> le-Da against another נָֽקְשָֽׁן׃ <WH5368> Na-ke-Shan. smote

קָרֵ֤א <WH7123> ka-Re cried מַלְכָּא֙ <WH4430> mal-Ka The king בְּחַ֔יִל <WH2429> be-Cha-yil, aloud לְהֶֽעָלָה֙ <WH5954> le-he-'a-Lah to bring לְאָ֣שְׁפַיָּ֔א <WH826> le-'A-she-fai-Ya, in the astrologers; כַּשְׂדָּיֵא kas-da-ye ככַּשְׂדָּאֵ֖י <WH3779> kas-da-'Ei Chaldean קוְגָזְרַיָּ֑א <WH1505> ve-ga-ze-rai-Ya; and the soothsayers עָנֵ֨ה <WH6032> 'a-Neh spake מַלְכָּ֜א <WH4430> mal-Ka [And] the king וְאָמַ֣ר׀ <WH560> ve-'a-Mar and said לְחַכִּימֵ֣י <WH2445> le-chak-ki-Mei to the wise בָבֶ֗ל <WH895> va-Vel, [men] of Babylon דִּ֣י <WH1768> di who כָל־ <WH3606> chol Any אֱ֠נָשׁ <WH606> 'E-nosh man דִּֽי־ <WH1768> di- who יִקְרֵ֞ה <WH7123> yik-Reh shall read כְּתָבָ֣ה <WH3792> ke-ta-Vah writing דְנָ֗ה <WH1836> de-Nah, this וּפִשְׁרֵהּ֙ <WH6591> u-fish-Reh me the interpretation יְחַוִּנַּ֔נִי <WH2324> ye-chav-vin-Na-ni, and shew אַרְגְּוָנָ֣א <WH711> 'ar-ge-va-Na with scarlet יִלְבַּ֗שׁ <WH3848> yil-Bash, thereof shall be clothed; וְהַמֹּונְכָא ve-ham-mon-cha כוְהַֽמְנִיכָ֤א <WH2002> ve-ham-ni-Cha chain קדִֽי־ <WH1768> di- who דַהֲבָא֙ <WH1722> da-ha-Va of gold עַֽל־ <WH5922> 'al- about צַוְּארֵ֔הּ <WH6676> tzav-ve-Reh, his neck וְתַלְתִּ֥י <WH8523> ve-tal-Ti and shall be the third בְמַלְכוּתָ֖א <WH4437> ve-mal-chu-Ta in the kingdom יִשְׁלַֽט׃ <WH7981> yish-Lat. ruler ס sa-Mek

אֱדַ֙יִן֙ <WH116> 'e-Da-yin Then; עָלֲלִין 'a-la-lin כעָֽלִּ֔ין <WH5954> 'al-Lin, bring in קכֹּ֖ל <WH3606> kol in all חַכִּימֵ֣י <WH2445> chak-ki-Mei wise מַלְכָּ֑א <WH4430> mal-Ka; the king's וְלָֽא־ <WH3809> ve-la- not כָהֲלִ֤ין <WH3546> cha-ha-Lin [men] but they could כְּתָבָא֙ <WH3792> ke-ta-Va the writing לְמִקְרֵ֔א <WH7123> le-mik-Re, read; וּפִשְׁרָא u-fish-ra כוּפִשְׁרֵ֖הּ <WH6591> u-fish-Reh interpretation קלְהוֹדָעָ֥ה <WH3046> le-ho-da-'Ah nor make known לְמַלְכָּֽא׃ <WH4430> le-mal-Ka. to the king

אֱ֠דַיִן <WH116> 'E-da-yin Then מַלְכָּ֤א <WH4430> mal-Ka was king בֵלְשַׁאצַּר֙ <WH1113> ve-le-shatz-Tzar Belshazzar שַׂגִּ֣יא <WH7690> sag-Gi greatly מִתְבָּהַ֔ל <WH927> mit-ba-Hal, troubled וְזִיוֹ֖הִי <WH2122> ve-zi-Yo-hi and his countenance שָׁנַ֣יִן <WH8133> sha-Na-yin was changed עֲל֑וֹהִי <WH5922> a-Lo-hi; in him וְרַבְרְבָנ֖וֹהִי <WH7261> ve-rav-re-va-No-hi and his lords מִֽשְׁתַּבְּשִֽׁין׃ <WH7672> Mish-tab-be-Shin. were astonied

מַלְכְּתָ֕א <WH4433> mal-ke-Ta [Now] the queen לָקֳבֵ֨ל <WH6903> lo-ko-Vel by reason מִלֵּ֤י <WH4406> mil-Lei of the words מַלְכָּא֙ <WH4430> mal-Ka of the king וְרַבְרְבָנ֔וֹהִי <WH7261> ve-rav-re-va-No-hi, and his lords לְבֵ֥ית <WH1005> le-Veit house מִשְׁתְּיָ֖א <WH4961> mish-te-Ya into the banquet; עַלֲלַת 'a-la-lat כעַלַּ֑ת <WH5954> 'al-Lat; bring in קעֲנָ֨ת <WH6032> 'a-Nat spake מַלְכְּתָ֜א <WH4433> mal-ke-Ta [and] the queen וַאֲמֶ֗רֶת <WH560> va-'a-Me-ret, and said מַלְכָּא֙ <WH4430> mal-Ka O king לְעָלְמִ֣ין <WH5957> le-'al-Min for ever חֱיִ֔י <WH2418> che-Yi, live אַֽל־ <WH409> 'al- let not יְבַהֲלוּךְ֙ <WH927> ye-va-ha-luCh trouble רַעְיוֹנָ֔ךְ <WH7476> ra'-yo-Nach, thy thoughts וְזִיוָ֖יךְ <WH2122> ve-zi-Vaich thee nor let thy countenance אַל־ <WH409> 'al- not יִשְׁתַּנּֽוֹ׃ <WH8133> yish-tan-No. be changed

אִיתַ֨י <WH383> 'i-Tai There is גְּבַ֜ר <WH1400> ge-Var a man בְּמַלְכוּתָ֗ךְ <WH4437> be-mal-chu-Tach, in thy kingdom דִּ֠י <WH1768> di whom ר֣וּחַ <WH7308> Ru-ach in whom [is] the spirit אֱלָהִ֣ין <WH426> 'e-la-Hin gods קַדִּישִׁין֮ <WH6922> kad-di-Shin of the holy בֵּהּ֒ beh וּבְיוֹמֵ֣י <WH3118> u-ve-yo-Mei and in the days אֲב֗וּךְ <WH2> 'a-Vuch, of thy father נַהִיר֧וּ <WH5094> na-hi-Ru light וְשָׂכְלְתָנ֛וּ <WH7924> ve-sa-che-le-ta-Nu and understanding וְחָכְמָ֥ה <WH2452> ve-cha-che-Mah and wisdom כְּחָכְמַת־ <WH2452> ke-cha-che-mat- like the wisdom אֱלָהִ֖ין <WH426> 'e-la-Hin of the gods הִשְׁתְּכַ֣חַת <WH7912> hish-te-Cha-chat was found בֵּ֑הּ <WH99999> Beh; וּמַלְכָּ֤א <WH4430> u-mal-Ka in him whom the king נְבֻֽכַדְנֶצַּר֙ <WH5020> ne-vu-chad-netz-Tzar Nebuchadnezzar אֲב֔וּךְ <WH2> 'a-Vuch, thy father רַ֧ב <WH7229> rav master חַרְטֻמִּ֣ין <WH2749> char-tum-Min of the magicians אָֽשְׁפִ֗ין <WH826> 'a-she-Fin, astrologers כַּשְׂדָּאִין֙ <WH3779> kas-da-'In Chaldeans גָּזְרִ֔ין <WH1505> ga-ze-Rin, [and] soothsayers הֲקִימֵ֖הּ <WH6966> ha-ki-Meh made אֲב֥וּךְ <WH2> 'a-Vuch [I say] thy father מַלְכָּֽא׃ <WH4430> mal-Ka. the king

כָּל־ <WH3606> kol- all קֳבֵ֡ל <WH6903> ko-Vel according to דִּ֣י <WH1768> di whom ר֣וּחַ׀ <WH7308> Ru-ach spirit יַתִּירָ֡ה <WH3493> yat-ti-Rah an excellent וּמַנְדַּ֡ע <WH4486> u-man-Da' and knowledge וְשָׂכְלְתָנ֡וּ <WH7924> ve-sa-che-le-ta-Nu and understanding מְפַשַּׁ֣ר <WH6590> me-fash-Shar interpreting חֶלְמִין֩ <WH2493> chel-Min of dreams וַֽאַֽחֲוָיַ֨ת <WH263> va-'a-cha-va-Yat and shewing אֲחִידָ֜ן <WH280> 'a-chi-Dan of hard sentences וּמְשָׁרֵ֣א <WH8271> u-me-sha-Re and dissolving קִטְרִ֗ין <WH7001> kit-Rin, of doubts הִשְׁתְּכַ֤חַת <WH7912> hish-te-Cha-chat were found בֵּהּ֙ <WH99999> beh בְּדָ֣נִיֵּ֔אל <WH1841> be-Da-ni-Yel, in the same Daniel דִּֽי־ <WH1768> di- whom מַלְכָּ֥א <WH4430> mal-Ka whom the king שָׂם־ <WH7761> som- command שְׁמֵ֖הּ <WH8036> she-Meh named בֵּלְטְשַׁאצַּ֑ר <WH1096> be-le-te-shatz-Tzar; Belteshazzar כְּעַ֛ן <WH3705> ke-'An now דָּנִיֵּ֥אל <WH1841> da-ni-Yel let Daniel יִתְקְרֵ֖י <WH7123> yit-ke-Rei be called וּפִשְׁרָ֥ה <WH6591> u-fish-Rah the interpretation יְהַֽחֲוֵֽה׃ <WH2324> ye-Ha-cha-Veh. and he will shew פ Peh

בֵּאדַ֙יִן֙ <WH116> be-Da-yin Then דָּֽנִיֵּ֔אל <WH1841> da-ni-Yel, was Daniel הֻעַ֖ל <WH5954> hu-'Al brought in קֳדָ֣ם <WH6925> ko-Dam before מַלְכָּ֑א <WH4430> mal-Ka; the king עָנֵ֨ה <WH6032> 'a-Neh spake מַלְכָּ֜א <WH4430> mal-Ka [And] the king וְאָמַ֣ר <WH560> ve-'a-Mar and said לְדָנִיֵּ֗אל <WH1841> le-da-ni-Yel, unto Daniel; אַנְתָּה 'an-tah כאַנְתְּ־ <WH607> 'ant- thou ה֤וּא <WH607> hu [Art] thou קדָנִיֵּאל֙ <WH1841> da-ni-yeL that Daniel דִּֽי־ <WH1768> di- who מִן־ <WH4481> min- which [art] of בְּנֵ֤י <WH1123> be-Nei the children גָלוּתָא֙ <WH1547> ga-lu-Ta of the captivity דִּ֣י <WH1768> di whom יְה֔וּד <WH3061> ye-Hud, of Judah דִּ֥י <WH1768> di whom הַיְתִ֛י <WH858> hay-Ti brought מַלְכָּ֥א <WH4430> mal-Ka whom the king אַ֖בִי <WH2> 'A-vi my father מִן־ <WH4481> min- out of יְהֽוּד׃ <WH3061> ye-Hud. Judah
